player

Class MiniMaxPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • player.MiniMaxPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    scotlandyard.Player

    public class MiniMaxPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements scotlandyard.Player
    A class for a player in a Scotland Yard game, implementing Player. A player of this class will choose a move automatically, by creating a game tree, with alpha-beta pruning, and selecting a move based on the MiniMax algorithm. The score for each possible state of the game is based on numerous factors.
    See Also:
    the interface for a Player in this game. TODO better order valid moves to improve alpha-beta pruning TODO make score more complex

      • TRANSPORT_WEIGHTER

        protected static final Weighter<scotlandyard.Transport> TRANSPORT_WEIGHTER
        A lambda function implements Weighter, to be passed to Dijkstra's. This Weighter assigns a higher weight to transports with which players start with less tickets for.

      • AINODE_COMPARATOR

        private static final java.util.Comparator<AINode> AINODE_COMPARATOR

    • Method Detail

      • notify

        public void notify(int location,
                   java.util.List<scotlandyard.Move> moves,
                   java.lang.Integer token,
                   scotlandyard.Receiver receiver)
        Gets the current state of the game from a Receiver (the Scotland Yard model), chooses a move, and makes the receiver play it. This method should be called by the receiver.
        Specified by:
        notify in interface scotlandyard.Player
        Parameters:
        location - the location of the player to request a move from.
        moves - a list of valid moves the player can make.
        token - the token to verify correct player returns a move: it is given back to the receiver.
        receiver - the Receiver who makes this method call.

      • score

        protected scotlandyard.Move score(int depth,
                                  boolean mrx)
        Calculates scores for all given moves.
        Returns:
        the move which results in the game state with the highest score after looking at every possibility after depth moves are played.

      • generateTree

        private void generateTree(ScotlandYardGameTree gameTree,
                          int depth,
                          boolean max)
        Generates a gameTree given the head node, which should have have gameTree.head as an AINode whose index field should be a ScotlandYardState object holding the current state of the game.
        Parameters:
        gameTree - the graph containing just the head node of the MiniMax tree
        depth - depth to which to generate the tree
        max - true if this player wants to maximise the score

      • MiniMax

        private java.lang.Double MiniMax(AINode node,
                                 int depth,
                                 double alpha,
                                 double beta,
                                 boolean max)
        Implements the MiniMax algorithm with alpha-beta pruning.
        Parameters:
        node - the AINode from which to create a tree from. node will be head of the (sub)tree.
        depth - the number of lays to generate for the tree.
        alpha - should be set to initial value Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.
        beta - should be set to initial value Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        max - If true, the player who's turn it is in node.getGameState() should be a maximising player, else minimising player.
        Returns:
        the best possible score that scoreMoveTicket or scoreMoveDouble assigns that node.getGameState().getCurrentPlayer() can get, based on a tree of depth depth.

      • calculateScore

        protected void calculateScore(AINode node)
        Calculates a score for a given node's game state, and sets said node's score.
        Parameters:
        node - the node to calculate the score for.

      • scoreDistancesState

        private java.lang.Double scoreDistancesState(ScotlandYardState state)
        Returns a score for a state, based on how far away MrX is from each detective.
        Parameters:
        state - the state to score.
        Returns:
        the calculated score for the state, based only on how far MrX is from the detectives.
